channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Russian oligarch lambasts country's 'massacre'
item.description: Businessman Oleg Tinkov is one of the most high profile Russians to publicly condemn the war.

item.title: Russia releases video of intercontinental ballistic missile launch
item.description: President Putin says the new Sarmat missile is food for thought for those who try to threaten Russia.

item.title: Ukraine war: Mariupol commander makes 'last' plea for help
item.description: Major Serhiy Volyna says his troops are heavily outnumbered and running out of supplies.

item.title: Ukraine war: Holocaust survivor aged 91 among Mariupol's civilian dead - reports
item.description: The woman reportedly died in a basement more than 80 years after surviving the city's Nazi occupiers.

item.title: French election: Macron and Le Pen clash in TV presidential debate
item.description: Emmanuel Macron and Marine Le Pen take part in an animated contest four days before the election.

item.title: Working with assertive China a must - New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern
item.description: New Zealand's PM tells the BBC in an exclusive interview she'll work with China where possible.

item.title: Scott Morrison: Australia PM faces backlash over 'blessed' disability remark
item.description: Scott Morrison has been criticised for saying he is "blessed" not to have children with disabilities.

item.title: Covid: Woman caught virus twice within record 20 days
item.description: Spanish researchers say it's the shortest-known gap between two coronavirus infections.

item.title: Tesla profits soar as customers pay more
item.description: Elon Musk's Tesla has raised prices for its electric cars as it faces higher costs.

item.title: Alec Baldwin: Rust film producers were indifferent to gun safety - report
item.description: The makers of a film whose cinematographer was shot dead knew firearm safety rules were not being followed, a report says.

item.title: The young rebels fighting for democracy
item.description: The BBC gained rare access to Myanmar's jungle training camps where protesters are turned into soldiers.

item.title: Hot air balloon makes emergency landing onto Melbourne rooftops
item.description: A man on board filmed as the balloon bounced over roofs and trees during an emergency landing.

item.title: Macron v Le Pen: Five years of change on show in presidential debate
item.description: Marine Le Pen's last presidential debate was a disaster - but five years on things are different.

item.title: Struggling to survive in cash-starved Afghanistan
item.description: Eight months into Taliban rule, the economy and health services have been shattered as funding dries up.

item.title: Sudan anger over racist slur caught on air at Bashir trial
item.description: A derogatory remark during a live broadcast reveals how racism still permeates all sections of society.

item.title: KGF 2, RRR, Pushpa: The southern Indian films winning on Bollywood's turf
item.description: The recent theatrical success of movies like KGF 2 and RRR has revived a debate on the "pan-Indian" film.

item.title: Shanghai lockdown: Whole communities relocated in anti-Covid drive
item.description: One community faces relocation to quarantine facilities more than 100 miles (160km) away.

item.title: Emmanuel Macron: From political outsider to president
item.description: Emmanuel Macron was dismissed as an outsider five years ago. Now, he faces a new challenge: his own record.

item.title: French election: Far-right Le Pen's long quest for power in France
item.description: Marine Le Pen has taken France's National Rally to within touching distance of the presidency.

item.title: The Zomato and Swiggy riders risking their lives to deliver food in 10 minutes
item.description: The BBC followed overworked delivery riders as they raced against time to take food to customers.

item.title: Climate change, albinism and me
item.description: Coco shares her experience of living with albinism in Nigeria.

item.title: Wayne Quilliam: Photographing the diversity of Aboriginal Australia
item.description: Australia has hundreds of Indigenous groups - and Wayne Quilliam is hoping to photograph them all.

item.title: Irish Travellers say racism is causing a suicide crisis
item.description: More than one in 10 deaths in the community are recorded as suicide, with systematic racism being blamed.

item.title: Ukraine war: How a BBC journalist's family escaped the country
item.description: Vitaly Shevchenko's family fled Ukraine with the help of two BBC audience members.
